rComments: Buchanan is great. He's very serious about figure painting, so I suggest you don't clown around in this class. This, however, will be rewarding because you will learn a lot from this talented professor if you pay attention. You will definitely see an improvement in your figure paintings, regardless of skill level.
Incredibly thorough teaching skills on human anatomy- bones, muscles, articulation etc. Gives clear instructions, encouraging and inclusive of all drawing levels. Highly recommend this professor.

I actually got an account on this site just so i could rate this class. I took figure painting with Noah and he is one of the best art teacher I've had. Very thorough and comprehensive teaching style, a unique UCSC art teacher in his emphasis on realism and skill development. Please take this course so we can have more like it in the future!

I took Figure Drawing over the summer and it was possibly the BEST class I've taken in the art department. Noah is an amazing teacher, gave me tons of advice on my art and as long as you respect him - he'll help you to be the most amazing artist ever!

I'm very glad I took this class with Noah...he did a great job of breaking down the figure into many components--bone structure, body mass, the way the shadows form--stuff that, though boring, really helped with understanding the figure.  My work improved a lot, as did everyone else's in the class.  He didnt give enough critique though.
